SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.state

Class LevelState

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.state.LevelState
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollisionHandler, GameState
public class LevelState extends Object implements GameState, CollisionHandler
The LevelState class represents the state of a game level and manages various aspects of the game, including input handling, collision detection, actor management, and state transitions. It implements the GameState and CollisionHandler interfaces. This class is responsible for initializing the level, updating the game state, handling input events, managing the pause overlay, and cleaning up resources when the level is completed or reset. Key features of this class include: - Initializing and displaying the game level. - Updating the game state and handling collisions. - Managing input events for player controls and game state transitions. - Displaying and hiding the pause overlay. - Cleaning up resources and listeners when the level is completed or reset. - Assigning key bindings to players and setting up their movement and firing strategies. The class also provides methods for adding and removing PropertyChangeListeners, handling projectile collisions with enemies, and checking if the level is completed.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelState

      public LevelState(javafx.stage.Stage stage, LevelParent level, ActorManager actorManager, CollisionManager collisionManager, GameLoopManager gameLoopManager, StateTransitioner stateTransitioner)
      Represents the state of a level in the game.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage where the level is rendered.
      level - The parent level object.
      actorManager - Manages the actors within the level.
      collisionManager - Manages collision detection and handling.
      gameLoopManager - Manages the game loop.
      stateTransitioner - Handles transitions between different states.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the level state by setting up the scene and displaying the stage. If the scene is null, an error message is printed and the method returns early. Otherwise, the scene is set up, the stage is shown, and a message indicating successful initialization is printed. Additionally, a pause overlay is created.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface GameState

    • update

      public void update(long now)
      Updates the state of the level.
      Specified by:
      update in interface GameState
      Parameters:
      now - The current time in nanoseconds. If the level is not completed, this method performs the following actions: - Spawns enemy units in the level. - Updates all actors managed by the actor manager. - Removes destroyed actors from the actor manager. - Handles all collisions between actors. - Updates the level view. - Checks if the level is completed.

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles keyboard input events for the game.
      Specified by:
      handleInput in interface GameState
      Parameters:
      event - the KeyEvent to handle This method processes key press and release events to control the game's state and player movements. - When the game is paused, only the SPACE key can resume the game. - When the game is running: - Pressing the SPACE key pauses the game. - Pressing other keys adds them to the activeKeys set for movement. - Releasing keys removes them from the activeKeys set.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up the current level state by performing necessary cleanup operations. This includes removing health handlers from all players and invoking the cleanup method on the actor manager. This method is called when the level state needs to be reset or disposed of. It ensures that all resources and handlers associated with the current level are properly released.
      Specified by:
      cleanup in interface GameState

    • setupScene

      private void setupScene(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Sets up the scene and registers input event handlers.
      Parameters:
      scene - The scene to set on the stage.

    • getScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
      Retrieves the current scene associated with this level state.
      Specified by:
      getScene in interface GameState
      Returns:
      the current Scene object.

    • onExplosionStarted

      public void onExplosionStarted()
      This method is called when an explosion starts. It sets the state to indicate that an explosion is currently active.
      Specified by:
      onExplosionStarted in interface CollisionHandler

    • onExplosionFinished

      public void onExplosionFinished()
      This method is called when an explosion has finished. It sets the isExplosionActive flag to false, indicating that the explosion is no longer active.
      Specified by:
      onExplosionFinished in interface CollisionHandler

    • onGameLoopChange

      private void onGameLoopChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
      Handles changes in the game loop state. This method is triggered when a property change event occurs, specifically when the "paused" property changes.
      Parameters:
      evt - the property change event containing the new state of the game loop.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a PropertyChangeListener to the listener list. The listener is registered for all properties.
      Parameters:
      listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be added

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a PropertyChangeListener from the listener list. This method should be called to unregister a listener that was previously added.
      Parameters:
      listener - the PropertyChangeListener to be removed

    • onProjectileHitEnemy

      public void onProjectileHitEnemy(UserPlane userPlane, ActiveActor enemy)
      Handles projectile collisions with enemies.
      Specified by:
      onProjectileHitEnemy in interface CollisionHandler
      Parameters:
      userPlane - The user plane involved in the collision.
      enemy - The enemy involved in the collision.

    • addPauseButton

      private void addPauseButton(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Adds a pause button to the scene.
      Parameters:
      scene - The current scene where the button will be added.

    • createPauseOverlay

      private void createPauseOverlay()
      Creates a pause overlay for the current level. This method initializes the PauseOverlay object with the game loop manager and state transitioner, and prints a message indicating the creation of the pause overlay for the current level.

    • handlePause

      public void handlePause()
      Handles the pause action by displaying the pause overlay on the screen. This method ensures that the pause overlay is added to the level's root children if it is not already present. It also requests focus for the pause overlay to ensure it is interactive. The method runs on the JavaFX Application Thread using Platform.runLater.

    • handleResume

      public void handleResume()
      Handles the resumption of the game from a paused state. This method removes the pause overlay from the game's root node and requests focus back to the game level.

    • checkLevelCompletion

      private void checkLevelCompletion()
      Checks the completion status of the current level.

      This method performs the following checks:

      • If all users are destroyed, it cleans up the actor manager and fires a property change event indicating a loss.
      • If the user has reached the target, it cleans up the actor manager, marks the level as completed, calculates the next level number, and fires a property change event indicating the level change.

    • allUsersAreDestroyed

      public boolean allUsersAreDestroyed()
      Checks if all users (players) are destroyed. A user is considered destroyed if their health is less than or equal to 0.
      Returns:
      true if any of the users are destroyed, false otherwise.

    • assignPlayerKeyBindings

      private void assignPlayerKeyBindings()
      Assigns key bindings to players based on their index. This method retrieves the list of players and the number of players from the actor manager and state transitioner respectively. It then assigns specific key bindings to each player: - Player 1: W, A, S, D for movement - Player 2: Arrow keys for movement For each player, the method also assigns a movement strategy using the assigned key bindings and a predefined plane speed. The key bindings and movement strategy are stored in the playerKeyBindingsMap and assigned to the UserPlane object.
